abstract: A promotion that, although expected, represented a sharp turn in style and substance for MasterCard, a conservative payment company.
snippet: A promotion that, although expected, represented a sharp turn in style and substance for MasterCard, a conservative payment company.
lead_paragraph: MasterCard named a onetime star at Citigroup as its next chief executive on Monday, a widely expected move that could nonetheless shake up the giant payment company. The appointment of the executive, Ajay Banga, is to take effect on July 1, the company said. MasterCard hired Mr. Banga as president and chief operating officer last August and signaled early that he would succeed Robert W. Selander, who has held the top job since 1997.

headline.main: Naming a New Chief, MasterCard Signals It Is Open to Changes
headline.print_headline: Naming a New Chief, MasterCard Signals It Is Open to Changes

byline.original: By Andrew Martin and Eric Dash

abstract: MasterCard named a onetime star at Citigroup as its next chief executive on Monday, a widely expected move that could nonetheless shake up the giant payment company, The New York Times reported.
snippet: MasterCard named a onetime star at Citigroup as its next chief executive on Monday, a widely expected move that could nonetheless shake up the giant payment company, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: MasterCard named a onetime star at Citigroup as its next chief executive on Monday, a widely expected move that could nonetheless shake up the giant payment company, The New York Times’s Andrew Martin and Eric Dash reported.

headline.main: New Chief at MasterCard Signals It’s Open to Change
